Room.Name: Inside the Chapel
Room.Description: You are in a small, dark chapel. The dark brown glass in the tiny windows do not let much light through. A few rows of worn wooden benches stand here.

Exit.Description: The chapel door is made of dark wood.

ExtraDescription.Description: The windows must be meant to be dark. At least they are completely clean.
The benches are not of the comfortable kind.

Room.Name: Stairwell into Darkness
Room.Description: You sense even more danger coming from below but are urged onward ...

Room.Name: The Acolyte's Bedroom
Room.Description: This is why you were not welcomed at the entrance by the tomb's faithful servants ... blood and gore is ankle deep in here. Oh NO! the door shut behind you! It's a trap! A bloodied corpse of an acolyte is lying here ... A bloodied corpse of an acolyte is lying here ... A bloodied corpse of an acolyte is lying here ...

ExtraDescription.Description: Mauled and torn apart ... throats were ripped out and guts spilled on the floor ... you slip and land, planting yourself firmly in the slick wetness and splattering yourself with offal.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: You are at the west end of the Grand Hall of Kings. There is a doorway to the south with something strange written above it. Also on the floor are dried blood stains, but their color seems a little wrong.

ExtraDescription.Description: That's odd ... they seem a little GREEN.
Above the door is some strange writing! It is worn with age, but it refers to an ancient ruler named 'Shohan'.

Room.Name: The Shrine of Shohan
Room.Description: BLOOD EVERYWHERE! The walls are coated with blood, bits of bloody flesh lie at your feet, and torn clothing is scattered about. It wouldn't disturb you in the least except that it is all FRESH! What ever used to pass as an altar here, lies overturned and smashed. Doors lead to the south and to the north.

Room.Name: The Tomb of Shohan
Room.Description: Once beautiful, this place has been turned into a slaughterhouse by the hands of evil beings ... even more blood and dead, rotting flesh. This place looks like the feeding grounds of beasts and monsters. The overturned sarcophagus of the once powerful King Shohan lies here. A door leads to the north and a doorway has been hewn to the east.

ExtraDescription.Description: Now destroyed ... there is writing on it: 'All hail the new king; we serve the Roch'tar, the Undying One! Those who decline his worship shall be slaughtered!'

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Lower Chambers
Room.Description: You can tell that this area wasn't a part of the original construction. The walls have been hewn by a mighty force look as though they were CLAWED. The passage slopes upward here and also continues to the north.

ExtraDescription.Description: Something BIG must have done this job! There are traces of BLOOD in the claw marks.

Room.Name: The Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: This is the western wing of the Grand Hall of Kings. Your only exits are to the east and west in this gloomy hallway.

Room.Name: The Shrine of Cristis
Room.Description: Different than the rest, this place has not been desecrated. An altar still stands here and the walls show scenes from the life of Cristis the Kind, a ruler of the outlying regions west of Midgaard. There is a stone staircase leading down. The Ghost of Cristis the Kind stands here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It stands 2 feet high with the remnants of candle-wax on top. There is an inscription on the side: 'Praise the almighty Cristis the bringer of good and justice to the world. He who fought the evilest finally is at peace. May the Gods remember him forever ...'

His rest has been disturbed by evil creatures who have invaded his domain and grave. He holds up a parchment for you to read: Hello stranger and last hope for Midgaard and this tomb! This is a plea for aid by a man long since dead from this Earth. The forces of evil have taken control of this tomb and the Kings of old need your aid to free us and deliver us to peace once again. I think that I alone have been able to appear and communicate with the mortal world. Roch'tar, the reincarnate Vampire, now rules these tombs. You must find and defeat him and his minions! May God bless you on your Quest!

Room.Name: The Tomb of Cristis
Room.Description: Everything here has simply been destroyed. Exits lead north and west.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: Entrance Chamber to the Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: Whoever built this place must have been very rich indeed! Though you did enter through a rather small door this place has enough room to hold several score of people. The floor has a beautifully woven carpet, and the walls are covered in finely crafted tapestries. You can tell that these things must have been worth much but they have not lasted well throughout the ages. Massive doors lead off to the south and a large stone staircase leads up.

Exit.Description: Finely polished oak doors stand to the south.
You see a large set of stone stairs leading upwards to a small stone door at the top.

ExtraDescription.Description: It's rather small and looks quite heavy but maybe with some kind of leverage you could move it. It has a queerly shaped hole that looks big enough for an equally queerly shaped pole to fit inside. If only you had it!

The tapestries were woven into beautiful and exciting scenes of battles long ago. One on the left your shows the historic battle between Jubal the Benevolent and Hroth Kragen's forces that eventually Jubal's army won (of course).
Though quite cracked they do look very stable.
They're HUGE! They are at least 12 feet tall and about 10 feet wide. If not for one thing they would be perfectly preserved. There appears to be some letters crudely scratched into the wood.

'Beware here all of man, because past here lies only death.' Insho'rkthon brsskra-lehsn Roch'tar Beneath, there are two criss-crossing scratchmarks in an X formation that look like someone (or something) raked their claws across the wood.

Room.Name: The Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: A long hallway stretches east and west. On the southern side of the hall there are many doors, each with the name of a king who has died and is entombed here. The hallway is beautiful yet chilling. Even though the area has been kept well by acolytes, there remains a stench of the undead.

Exit.Description: The door has written above it: 'May all the lands thank Crotus the Victor. Without his guidance this kingdom would not have stood.'

Room.Name: The Shrine of Crotus
Room.Description: Mostly rubble, this place used to be the shrine of the famous king Crotus, who saved the northern regions from being overrun by the goblin hordes of 100 years ago. If not for him, Midgaard of course would have eventually been conquered as well. Though Crotus was a goodly king, it was rumored that he turned to the dark ways in his dying years ... and died an evil man.

Room.Name: The Tomb of Crotus
Room.Description: A sarcophagus lies in the middle of the room and seems undisturbed. A hole has been knocked into the east wall.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: You are in the western part of the Grand Hall of Kings. To the south is a door and to the east and west the hall continues.

Room.Name: The Shrine of Mitnar
Room.Description: Mitnar was a gruesome beast of a man ... he loved battle ... and nothing else. Warriors did love Mitnar, and all fighting men honored him. On the wall is depicted battle after battle after battle. A small opening has been shaped carefully to the east.

Room.Name: The Tomb of Mitnar
Room.Description: The wall paintings show men and women warriors alike bowing down to Mitnar, prisoners of war being put to the sword by Mitnar, and great heaps of gold and weapons under the feet of Mitnar. Where his coffin was, there is now only a rectangular blemish on the floor of the dusty room.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: You are still walking through the gloomy hallway.

Room.Name: The Shrine of Frath
Room.Description: Little chunks of dried meat are spattered throughout this room. The walls are covered in gore. Almost as if they were painted ... ICK! You can almost make out the design!

Room.Name: The Tomb of Frath
Room.Description: UGH! The sarcophagus is opened up and the mummified body lies out in the open, ripped to pieces. Gnawed pieces of flesh and bone are strewn here.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Grand Hall of Kings
Room.Description: You are at the western end of the Grand Hall of Kings. There is a door leading north and the hallway continues west.

Room.Name: The Shrine of Jubal
Room.Description: This was once beautiful. Now the huge tapestries have been torn down and the carpeting pulled up ... the paintings on the ceiling are unreadable and the altar is crumbled.

Room.Name: The Tomb of Jubal
Room.Description: The smell coming off of the opened sarcophagus is nauseating. The floor is slightly crumpled and walls are raked ... but the worst part is the mummy ... Jubal the Benevolent is missing his head!

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: This room has been totally hollowed out and smoothed, and a pit has been drilled in the center of the floor. There are extensive gruesome paintings of beasts and monsters terrorizing the countryside; vampires sucking the blood of beasts and humans alike.

ExtraDescription.Description: There is a tiny painting of a vault in this mural ... and it seems to be a reflected picture of the vault ... the word in tiny print is 'rathcor'.

Room.Name: The Lower Chambers and Tombs of the Undead
Room.Description: The stench of death is heavy in these caverns.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Forbidden Catacombs
Room.Description: You have entered the forbidden catacombs. This cave system must have been built long ago. The air is dank and smells of something dead ... or maybe undead. Enter here at your own risk ... something evil abides.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Exit.Description: You see unfathomable blackness to the south ...

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: Den of the Vampire
Room.Description: Your mind whirls in the hideous madness of this place. The stench is horrendous and dead bodies, sucked of life, lay all over. One coffin lies in the center of the room ... waiting for YOU!

Exit.Description: A jet black coffin ... who knows what lurks beneath.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Room.Name: The Catacombs
Room.Description: Stone walls, musty air ... the earth seems to moan softly.

Exit.Description: There is a secret door here.

Room.Name: The Gilded Hallway
Room.Description: Wow! Although this hallway is quite filthy and dusty, it is noticeably different than the rest of the catacombs ... but you don't feel safe yet. The walls faintly show ancient detailed etchings in gold and silver of ancient rituals ... not all of which seem pleasant. The hallway continues north into the catacombs and further south as long as you can see.

Exit.Description: The glow of your light reflects off the walls and you see the catacombs.
The glow of your light reflects off the walls ... the gilded hallway.

ExtraDescription.Description: Beautiful yet disturbing, they urge you to move onward.

Room.Name: The Gilded Hallway
Room.Description: Ancient etchings and writing in intricate gold and silver designs fill these walls. You are tempted to linger and examine them closely. Your light source flickers off the walls showing you exits north and south.

Exit.Description: Your light reveals more of the hallway.
Your light reveals more of the hallway.

ExtraDescription.Description: Beautiful yet disturbing, they urge you to move onward.

Room.Name: The Gilded Hallway
Room.Description: Ancient etchings and writing in intricate gold and silver designs fill these walls. You are tempted to linger and examine them closely. Your light source flickers off the walls showing you exits north and south.

Exit.Description: Your light reveals more of the hallway.
Your light reveals more of the hallway.

ExtraDescription.Description: Beautiful yet disturbing, they urge you to move onward.

Room.Name: The Gilded Hallway
Room.Description: Ancient etchings and writing in intricate gold and silver designs fill these walls. You are tempted to linger and examine them closely. Your light source flickers off the walls showing you exits north and south.

Exit.Description: Your light reveals more of the hallway.
Your light reveals more of the hallway.

ExtraDescription.Description: Beautiful yet disturbing, they urge you to move onward.

Room.Name: The Gilded Hallway
Room.Description: Ancient etchings and writing in intricate gold and silver designs fill these walls. You are tempted to linger and examine them closely. Your light source flickers off the walls showing you exits north.

Exit.Description: Your light reveals more of the hallway.

ExtraDescription.Description: Beautiful yet disturbing, they urge you to move onward.

Room.Name: A Secret Passageway
Room.Description: A secret passage! You wonder where it may lead!

ExtraDescription.Description: The door closed on you so softly that you didn't even notice!

Room.Name: A Secret Passageway
Room.Description: A secret passage! You wonder where it may lead!

Room.Name: The Short Way to Hell ...
Room.Description: You fall ... hmm .... it's getting really HOT! You fall ... you fall ... Slowly you are cooking as you fall further ... your skin is burning and your hair evaporates ... you fall ... and fall ... and STOP...!! Welcome to HELL! But even in Hell we give you another chance.

Exit.Description: The fires of hell grow hotter to the north...

Room.Name: Inside the coffin
Room.Description: You are inside a coffin. It seems rather cramped in here. You can climb up out of the coffin, or you can wait for here the real occupant to join you.

NPC.name: skeleton bony
NPC.description: Brown bones with tufts of clothing still hanging from them. This skeleton looks very mindless but still dangerous ...

NPC.name: undead zombie
NPC.description: His body is totally white and slowly rotting away. Each Zombie looks quite different from the next because they were, of course, once alive and human.
NPC.longDescription: An undead zombie sits here munching on something ...

NPC.name: undead ghoul
NPC.description: The ghoul no longer resembles the adventurer he once was. Nonetheless he looks like he hasn't forgot his fighting skills.
NPC.longDescription: A ghoul is here staring at you hungrily.

NPC.name: undead wraith
NPC.description: The wraith no longer has a material form. He is wearing a tattered black robe which hides all but the darkness of his face and the glimmer in his eyes.
NPC.longDescription: You spot a wraith advancing towards you from the shadows.

NPC.name: undead guardian vampire
NPC.description: The guardian vampire looks quite EVIL. Just by looking at him the hair on your arms raises. He looks mighty tough to be just a minor minion.
NPC.longDescription: A vampire is here hiding his face from your light source.

NPC.name: priest
NPC.description: Obviously a goodly man, you feel closer to God just by gazing upon this man. Dressed in white, fine white hair, and a soft slightly wrinkled face ... this man has a sacred beauty. You see a halo around his head.
NPC.longDescription: A priest of God stands here solemnly speaking words of praise.

NPC.name: Mi-Go Fungi
NPC.description: Mi-Go, the Fungi from Yuggoth ... it is a pinkish being about five feet long; with a crustaceous body bearing a vast pair of membranous wings and several sets of articulate limbs, body a sort of convoluted ellipsoid, covered with multitudes of very small antennae, where a head would ordinarily be. These beings sometimes walk on all their legs and sometimes on the hind pair only.

NPC.name: nightgaunt
NPC.description: ... shocking and uncouth black thing with smooth, oily, skin, unpleasant horns that curve inward toward each other, bat wings whose beating make no sound, ugly prehensile paws, and a barbed tail that lashes disquietingly. And worst of all, it makes absolutely no sound or speech and smiles not at all because it has no face, only a suggestive blackness where a face ought to be ...

NPC.name: hunting horror
NPC.description: Serving Nyarlathotep and Roch'tar, these beings are hunting for victims. They resemble enormous ropy black serpents or worms possessing bat-like or umbrella-like wings. Their forms continually shift and change, twitching and writhing, so it is hard to look at them. They speak in great harsh voices. A hunting horror is HUGE, normally around 40 feet long.
NPC.longDescription: The hunting horror is here in wait of an unwary traveler.

NPC.name: weeds
NPC.description: Just some unpleasant looking vine-like growths ...
NPC.longDescription: Some weeds are creeping across the floor.

NPC.name: snapper joe
NPC.description: What an ugly fiend! He is about 6'6'' and has mostly greenish skin with bright red hair. Half his face is burnt off and he has a perpetual smile. He is called up from his service in hell in order to aid the Undying One.
NPC.longDescription: Snapper Joe is standing here leering at you chillingly.

NPC.name: X-ist eater
NPC.description: A large hairy monstrous beast, the only LIVE thing you have seen down here. It stands approximately 8 feet tall and hunches over to fit in this small room. It has a pair of tremendous claws that it uses to rip and tear. It has dog-like face except ... different. Bright glowing eyes and a grimace lead you to believe that he knew that you were coming.
NPC.longDescription: An X-ist flesh eater is sitting here munching on some coffin remains

NPC.name: spirit ghost king crotus
NPC.description: Floating above the ground here and looking a bit dead, he whispers softly into the air: The forces of evil have unlocked my spirit as well as one other. Free me from this misery, anyone that can hear. The peace of the grave calls me but I am blocked from its quiet.
NPC.longDescription: The spirit of King Crotus is floating lazily above the floor.

NPC.name: rock slug
NPC.description: It is a large brownish slug. Got any salt? Didn't think so ...
NPC.longDescription: A rock slug is slowly creeping along, leaving a slime trail behind it.

NPC.name: etcher
NPC.description: Quite insane, the mad etcher has been here for es. His hair is white; he babbles nonsense to himself; a layer of dust covers his out-of-date clothing; and he seems to be working on the same portion of the wall near the base ... oh and he seems quite blind. He leers insanely at you and says 'heh heh what can I do for you children? Please don't mind my wife, she is always like that ... hello dear can you make some tea for our company? Oh good! Now sit right down will you? Would you like hot or cold tea? Yes the weather is ...' And on he babbles ...
NPC.longDescription: The mad etcher is sitting here babbling to himself and working on the wall.

NPC.name: wife ghost specter
NPC.description: You can barely make her out ... though it almost makes you vomit. She is missing half her head. The remaining half is smashed in horribly like she took a nasty fall. Her one damaged eye hangs on its own. She smiles insanely at you thru a broken jaw and missing teeth. One hand of hers is resting on the shoulder of the etcher ... her husband.
NPC.longDescription: The spectral wife of the etcher is very faintly floating here.

NPC.name: body
NPC.description: YUK! It's ugly, disgusting ... it smells ... it also moves a bit!
NPC.longDescription: A half-decomposed body is lying in the corner here.

Item.Name: candlestick
Item.LongDescription: A pewter candlestick is standing here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is a rather old-looking three-armed candlestick made from pewter. Its candles are a yellowish white colour.

Item.Name: tickler
Item.LongDescription: A nightgaunt's tickler has been left here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A horrid black mass of gooey tentacles obviously ripped from the corpse of a nightgaunt ... disgusting.

Item.Name: plasma webbing
Item.LongDescription: A pile of pink material is lying here

ExtraDescription.Description: Yuck, mossy and wet. It looks like some sort of webbing.

Item.Name: rod key
Item.LongDescription: A queerly shaped rod is lying here.

ExtraDescription.Description: This rod looks sort of octagonal, and sort of like a key and crowbar. You recognize that it will probably fit the lock at the entrance of the tombs.

Item.Name: large black dirty key
Item.LongDescription: A large black dirty key is lying here

ExtraDescription.Description: One of those traditional old lock type keys ... except huge, black and filthy ... hmm ... like it has been buried for some time ...

Item.Name: head jubal mummy
Item.ShortDescription: the mummified head of Jubal the Benevolent
Item.LongDescription: The mummified head of Jubal the Benevolent is lolling back and forth.

ExtraDescription.Description: ACK! It's half eaten away ... yet it is whole ... in fact I think it can be opened and closed ... is there something in its teeth!?!?!? ACK you do it!

Item.Name: ring black marble
Item.LongDescription: A black marble ring is lying here on the ground.

ExtraDescription.Description: It is pitch black and has beautiful swirls characteristic of marble all through it.

Item.Name: rapier thin
Item.LongDescription: A rapier is lying here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It seems so thin that it would be useless but at the same time it looks deadly.

Item.Name: sarcophagus coffin
Item.LongDescription: A stone sarcophagus is sitting here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A well crafted, if dusty and ancient, home for the afterworld, it seems to be able to be opened but needs a key.

Item.Name: iron heavy key
Item.LongDescription: A heavy iron key is lying here.

ExtraDescription.Description: It looks to be a very heavy old iron key.

Item.Name: flask wineflask
Item.LongDescription: A wineflask has been been left here.

ExtraDescription.Description: A nice leather wineflask that has somehow survived the ages in a coffin. The wine should be nicely aged.

Item.Name: coins
Item.ShortDescription: a mound of coins fit for a dead king
Item.LongDescription: You see a mound of coins fit for a dead king here

Item.Name: key
Item.LongDescription: The key to the coffin is lying here

ExtraDescription.Description: Neat you have the key to the coffin...is is a soft orange color and burns in your hand a bit.

Item.Name: rathcor
Item.ShortDescription: a hidden compartment in the room

ExtraDescription.Description: Ah HA! A hidden compartment!

Item.Name: rusty sword curved scimitar
Item.LongDescription: A sword has been left lying here

ExtraDescription.Description: Very rusty and old...it has a wide blade and chunks missing from its cutting edge.

Item.Name: piece slime
Item.LongDescription: You step on a piece of slime...your foot squishes a bit

ExtraDescription.Description: ICK! This is a piece of slug-like brownish green slime... Blech!

Item.Name: smock
Item.LongDescription: An artist's smock is lying here on the floor.

ExtraDescription.Description: It has paint and little shavings of different materials all over it. It is very old an smells of paint, mildew, and rot.

Item.Name: scroll tightly rolled
Item.LongDescription: A yellowing tightly rolled scroll is here

ExtraDescription.Description: It is tightly wound. The writing on the inside when opened up is very unreadable but the scroll has a seal on it with a grey : 88 88 8888 8888 88 88

Item.Name: auburn orb
Item.LongDescription: An orb is here

ExtraDescription.Description: You gaze into the orb and are almost lost in the swirling mists of color inside of this rare and beautiful object.

Item.Name: bar gold
Item.LongDescription: A bar of gold is lying here

ExtraDescription.Description: A nice little brick of gold...very dusty and old... it has some emblem on it...The emblem is a large 'J'

Item.Name: cape dark black
Item.LongDescription: A dark black cape is lying here

ExtraDescription.Description: The cape is gently flows and pulls in the light so evenly and perfectly that the cape seems to be simply a void of blackness. It is quite beautiful

Item.Name: flaming black sword long longsword
Item.LongDescription: A pitch-black long sword here
Item.ExtraFlags: Magic Frost Sharp Vorpal TwoHands Shocking Poison Unholy

ExtraDescription.Description: This sword is amazing! It almost wields itself! As you test it out, the flames seems to roar brighter as you go thru basic swordsman routines. it is obviously a great find!

Item.Name: breast plate dented worn
Item.ShortDescription: a worn and dented breast plate
Item.LongDescription: A piece of armour is here.

ExtraDescription.Description: Though this piece of armour is worn and dented it looks very usable.

Item.Name: key silver
Item.LongDescription: You see a silver key here.

ExtraDescription.Description: for the altar...
